result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Curley Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Curley Jacobs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Curley Jacobs was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total fines and costs in the amount of $443 to be paid by payment plan of $100 per month commencing October 1st, 2016 and to be paid on the 1st of each month thereafter.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment being entered in the amount of the unpaid balance.
Defendant to Submit a DNA sample.

Sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michael Curley Jacobs in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requesting to coordinate jail time with Milwaukee County and requests to adjourn sentencing until after 7/21/16. Sentencing date will be scheduled on August 2, 2016 at 1:15 pm. Plea questionniare filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Joint recommendation of 10 days in jail plus costs as to count 1. State moves to dismiss count 2.
